title: The Dow Lost All Its Third-Quarter Gains. Why the Bad Start to October May Not Mean Much
text:
The fourth quarter got off to a rocky start. The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 340 points, or 1.3%, on Tuesday, wiping out the gains in the third quarter. The last time the returns in a previous quarter were wiped out in the first day of the next quarter was October 2014, when the Dow fell 1.4% after rising 1.3% in the third quarter.

This is the fourth worst start to a fourth quarter since 1969—as far back as Barron’s looked. Investors started the day optimistic. The Dow was up 129 points at 10 a.m., but then came...
description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average dropped 1.3% on Oct. 1, wiping out third-quarter gains. But stocks are likely to recover.
